intro: Calandrinia oblongifolia var. humilis, commonly known as the dwarf redstem, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Portulacaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces vibrant pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its compact growth habit and drought tolerance make it an attractive and low-maintenance ornamental plant.
